title_en: AI Transparency Atlas: Framework, Scoring, and Real-Time Model Card Evaluation Pipeline
title_zh: AI透明度图册：框架、评分与实时模型卡片评估流程
summary_en: AI model documentation is fragmented across platforms and inconsistent in structure, preventing policymakers, auditors, and users from reliably assessing safety claims, data provenance, and version-level changes. We analyzed documentation from five frontier models (Gemini 3, Grok 4.1, Llama 4, GPT-5, and Claude 4.5) and 100 Hugging Face model cards, identifying 947 unique section names with extreme naming variation. Usage information alone appeared under 97 distinct labels. Using the EU AI Act Annex IV and the Stanford Transparency Index as baselines, we developed a weighted transparency framework with 8 sections and 23 subsections that prioritizes safety-critical disclosures (Safety Evaluation: 25%, Critical Risk: 20%) over technical specifications. We implemented an automated multi-agent pipeline that extracts documentation from public sources and scores completeness through LLM-based consensus. Evaluating 50 models across vision, multimodal, open-source, and closed-source systems cost less than $3 in total and revealed systematic gaps. Frontier labs (xAI, Microsoft, Anthropic) achieve approximately 80% compliance, while most providers fall below 60%. Safety-critical categories show the largest deficits: deception behaviors, hallucinations, and child safety evaluations account for 148, 124, and 116 aggregate points lost, respectively, across all evaluated models.
summary_zh: 当前AI模型文档分散于多个平台且结构不一致，导致政策制定者、审计人员及用户难以可靠评估安全性声明、数据来源及版本级变更。本研究分析了五个前沿模型（Gemini 3、Grok 4.1、Llama 4、GPT-5与Claude 4.5）及100份Hugging Face模型卡片的文档，识别出947个具有极端命名差异的独立章节名称，仅使用说明信息就出现了97种不同标签。基于《欧盟人工智能法案》附件四和斯坦福透明度指数基准，我们构建了包含8个主章节、23个子章节的加权透明度框架，该框架优先考虑安全关键信息披露（安全评估占25%，关键风险占20%）而非技术规格说明。我们开发了自动化多智能体流程，可从公开源提取文档并通过基于大语言模型的共识机制进行完整性评分。对涵盖视觉、多模态、开源与闭源系统的50个模型进行评估的总成本低于3美元，结果揭示了系统性缺陷：前沿实验室（xAI、微软、Anthropic）的合规率约为80%，而多数供应商低于60%。安全关键类别存在最大短板：所有受评估模型在欺骗行为、幻觉及儿童安全评估方面分别累计失分148、124和116点。
